skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "For the King! Charge", while this Mount is equipped, for Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

Passive Ability: "For the King! Charge" for Cavalry units
	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Cleanse Them in the Name of the Lady", while this Mount is equipped, for Flying units
	(all units in army)

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Cleanse Them in the Name of the Lady!

effects.description:
Passive Ability: "Cleanse Them in the Name of the Lady" for Flying units
	(all units in army)

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Cleanse Them in the Name of the Lady!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or Dragon!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Blessing of the Lady"

skillTree.localised_description: Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord has killed many of the evil and monstrous creatures that roam the land, gaining honour and glory and now other nobles ride with him following his example... even saving some peasants in the process

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Anti-Large Bonus: +10 for all Cavalry and Flying units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unlike most Bretonnian nobles, this Lord makes sure his men, peasant and knights alike, have trained properly in times of peace so they can fare better in times of war

effects.description:
Anti-Infantry Bonus: +8 for all melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Damage: +7% for all Ranged units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Time Reduction: +8% for Trebuchet units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It´s the sacred duty of all nobles to defend the Lands, but this one is known for defending even the peasants lives too

effects.description:
Construction cost: -7% for all buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

skillTree.localised_description: Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn.

skillTree.localised_description: The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.

skillTree.localised_description: Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.

skillTree.localised_description: When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...

skillTree.localised_description: There are literally no opponents too great for them to face down. None.

skillTree.localised_description: Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.

skillTree.localised_description: Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Peasant Bowmen, Mounted Yeomen Archers, and Field Trebuchet units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
Those whom the Lady has blessed fight with an unquenchable, almost super-human zeal, for they know that she sees them.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: "The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +8%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: In the glory of the charge is this Knight most alive, ever in the forefront of battle.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A master of the feint and riposte, this Knight's skill at turning an enemy's strength against them is legendary.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: So great is this Knight's skill with a lance that none can unhorse them.

effects.description:
Replenishes 5% campaign movement range after winning a battle
	(own army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Haughty, proud, and skilful, this Knight never takes a backward step in the face of adversity.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Steeled by this Knight's bravery, those around them fight with the courage of the Breton himself.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: With a heart of stone and resolute temper this Knight stands unbowed, spilling the foe's blood with each sweep and thrust.
Unbending even in the face of the greatest beasts, this Knight mounts their heads on the wall of his feasting chamber.
A hermit-Knight, this one nevertheless always returns to fight for his beloved king.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(own army)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This Knight has great contempt for those who eschew the martial values of meeting one's opponent face to face.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
"When the clarion call is sounded
	 I will ride out and fight in the name of Liege and Lady
	Whilst I draw breath the lands bequeathed
	 unto me will remain untainted by evil
	 Honour is all, Chivalry is all..."

"I set down my lance, symbol of duty
	I spurn those whom I love
	I relinquish all and take up the tools of my quest
	No obstacle will stand before me
	No plea for help shall find me waiting
	No moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle
	I give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek..."

"That which is sacrosanct I shall preserve
	 That which is sublime I will protect
	That which threatens I will destroy
	For my holy wrath will know no bounds..."
